message: Salt is a remote execution system similar to func and mcollective
written in python, of course! github: https://github.com/thatch45/salt screencast: http://blip.tv/thomas-s-hatch/salt-0-8-7-presentation-5180182 Release info: http://red45.wordpress.com/
Tell me what you all think!
I don't have time to watch the screencast and your readme doesn't have any usage examples -- can you outline what makes Salt appreciably different from Fabric, Pyro, Execnet and/or Pushy?
@bitprophet well, for one thing it goes better on steak than fabric. Just sayin'
@offby1 Spoken like somebody who's never had a steak n' silk sandwich! (hm. that sounds kind of dirty.)

Salt is more of an administration tool than an rpc layer. And unlike Fabric it uses its own daemon rather than ssh. Unlike Pyro it is very easy to integrate into an application, but does not create remote objects
A good example can be found here: https://github.com/thatch45/salt/wiki/Salt-Command-Line-Client
Salt uses a PUB-SUB mechanism to send commands to groups of machines in parallel
it is more like a simple, usable amqp broker.
